Ingredients:
1. 1 tbsp coconut oil, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, thumb-sized piece ginger, 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste 2. 1 tbsp smooth peanut butter, 500g sweet potato, 400ml can coconut milk, 200g bag spinach 3. 1 lime juiced, cooked rice, to serve
Recipe:
1. Melt 1 tbsp coconut oil in a saucepan over a medium heat and soften 1 chopped onion for 5 mins 2. Add 2 grated garlic cloves and a grated thumb-sized piece of ginger, and cook for 1 min. Stir in 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste, 1 tbsp smooth peanut butter and 500g sweet potato. 3. Then add 400ml coconut milk and 200ml water. Bring to the boil, turn down the heat and simmer, uncovered, for 25-30 min. 4. Stir through 200g spinach and the juice of 1 lime, and season well. Serve with cooked rice.

Ingredients:
1. 1 cauliflower, 2 tsp nigella seeds, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 3 tsp garam masala, 2 garlic cloves 2. 2cm piece ginger , 500g passata, 2 tbsp cashew nut butter, 50ml double cream, brown rice.
Recipe:
1. Heat oven to 200C, Toss the cauliflower florets with the nigella seeds, 1 tbsp of the oil and 2 tsp of the garam masala. Spread out onto a roasting tray and cook for 35-40 mins 2. heat the rest of the oil in a small pan. Add the garlic, ginger, passata and the remaining garam masala and leave to simmer, uncovered, for 10-15 mins. Stir in the cashew nut butter and cream 3. Serve the sauce over the brown rice, top with the roasted cauliflower

Ingredients:
1. 2 large sweet potatoes, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, 1 onion , 2 garlic cloves, 1 tsp paprika 2. 400g can chopped tomatoes, 1 small avocado , 1 red chilli , ½ small pack coriander , 3. 400g can mixed beans , 460g jar roasted red peppers , 1 tbsp coconut yogurt
Recipe:
1. Heat oven to 200C, Prick the sweet potatoes with a fork and bake for 40-45 mins. Meanwhile, heat the oil and cook the onion for about 10 mins 2. Add the garlic and paprika, and stir for 1 min. Tip in the tomatoes, leave for 10-15 mins. 3. To make the salsa, combine the avocado, chilli and coriander in a small bowl. Pour the mixed beans into the pan with the red peppers. 5 mins 4. Halve each baked potato, ladle over the chilli and spoon on the salsa. Add coconut yogurt.

Ingredients:
1. 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion, 4 garlic cloves, 250g chargrilled Mediterranean veg 2. 400g can chopped tomatoes, 1 tbsp small capers, 2 tbsp raisins, 350g rigatoni pasta 3. bunch basil leaves and parmesan
Recipe:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan and cook the onion for 8-10 mins, Add the garlic for the final 2 mins of cooking time. 2. Tip in the mixed veg, tomatoes, capers and raisins. 10 mins. Meanwhile, boil the kettle. 3. Pour the kettleful of water into a large pan with a little salt and bring back to the boil. Add the pasta and cook until tender 4. Tip the pasta into the sauce, Scatter with the basil leaves and parmesan. Serve

Ingredients:
1. 4 large red bell peppers, halved - seeds removed. 1 tbsp olive oil, Fine salt and freshly ground black pepper. 2. 1 ½ cups cooked rice, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion, ½ tsp fine salt, 2 cups cherry tomatoes cut. 3. ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro, 4 cloves garlic, 1 ½ teaspoons chili powder, 1 can (1 ½ cups) pinto beans, rinsed and drained 4. 1 tbsp lime juice. 1 cup grated mozzarella.
Recipe:
1. Roast the peppers: Preheat the oven to 220 degrees, Place the halved peppers in baking dish, Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil over the peppers and sprinkle them with salt and pepper. Bake 25 mins 2. Cook the rice: Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the rice to the boiling water for 30 mins 3. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil until shimmering. Add the onion and ½ teaspoon of the salt, 5 mins. Add tomatoes for another 5 min 4. Add the cilantro, garlic, chili powder, cook for 30 to 60 seconds. Remove the pot from the heat and add the rice, beans, lime juice and about 10 twists of black pepper. 5. Stuff each pepper generously with the rice mixture, Top the peppers with the cheese. Bake at 225 for 12 to 13 minutes, until the cheese is golden in spots. Serve warm
